sentences.chinese: 每一個偉大的演講撰稿人都知道這一點。

sentences.english: Several writers for the Guardian have made what I believe is an unjustifiable leap.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，衛報的幾位撰稿人來了個離譜的大躍進。
公司僱有幾個自由撰稿人。

sentences.english: Naomi Li is a freelance writer based in London.
sentences.chinese: 李潔華是駐倫敦的特約撰稿人。

sentences.english: At the end of 2001, I moved to Shanghai to be a career artist and free writer.
sentences.chinese: 2001年末旅居上海做職業畫家與自由撰稿人。

sentences.english: You may call me a newspaper addict or free-lance writer.
sentences.chinese: 叫我報蟲也好，叫我自由撰稿人也罷。

sentences.english: But Reagan didn’t need a speechwriter. He was a good one himself.
sentences.chinese: 但是里根根本不需要撰稿人，因爲他自己就能勝任。

sentences.english: But Reagan and his speechwriters insisted on keeping it in.
sentences.chinese: 但里根和撰稿人堅持保留這句話。

sentences.english: Peter Bregman speaks, writes, and consults on leadership. He is the CEO of Bregman Partners, Inc.
sentences.chinese: 彼得佈雷格曼是演說家，撰稿人和領導力諮詢師。

sentences.english: The successful copywriter is a master of apposite and evocative verbal images.
sentences.chinese: 成功的廣告文字撰稿人是貼切且能引起共鳴的大師。

sentences.english: Yuan Weijian is a freelance writer with a long-term interest in climate change.
sentences.chinese: 原瑋鍵，自由撰稿人，長期關注氣候變化議題。

definition: specially engaged/employed or commissioned for a special task
person who writes articles - newspapers, magazines, blogs (informal)/scribe/copyist/a talented writer of articles or of calligraphy
